cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf of Mexico, inland over Louisiana tonight, then racing through the Lower Mississippi Valley Saturday and toward the Ohio Valley/Great Lakes by early Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf coast (near the south-central or southeast Louisiana shoreline)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf coast from Louisiana eastward into Mississippi and coastal Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Great-Lakes site listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty post-tropical winds possible (25-35 mph) Sunday as the low passes nearby
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-2 inches of rain possible Sunday into early Monday as remnants track near or north of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility and localized ponding on docks/terminal yards
